post.title: Port Houston
post.description: Port Houston, or the Port of Houston Authority, is the public body that owns the Houston Ship Channel and operates one of the largest ports in the U.S.

node.title: No more 'sacrifice zones.' It's time for Port Houston to become a good neighbor.

children.text: The $1 trillion infrastructure bill directs funding to ports to invest in cleaner equipment that would help them repair relationships with communities and pursue environmental justice.

children.text: Dredging the Ship Channel to make it safer for ships with old, dirty, diesel-burning equipment will dump thousands of tons of unnecessary toxic pollution on people who live in Ship Channel communities.

node.title: Place, public health and Port Houston: A conversation with Jennifer Hadayia

children.text: Growing up along the industrial Ship Channel, Hadayia witnessed the tension of working where you live and embarked on a career to undo the generational harms that can come from degraded air quality.
